clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Bathing and Moisturizers on Skin Hydration in Atopic Dermatitis: an in Vivo Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Bathing and Moisturizers on Skin Hydration in Atopic Dermatitis: an in Vivo Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the hydration effect of various regimens of skin bathing and moisturizer application on atopic dermatitis

primary_outcome.measure: Skin hydration (skin capacitance) by using Corneometer and the trans-epidermal water loss value by using Tewameter of various regimens of bathing and moisturizer application
primary_outcome.time_frame: The skin hydration (capacitance value) and transepidermal water loss value were assessed at baseline and every 30 minutes for 120 minutes after each regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: skin hydration (capacitance value) by using Corneometer and transepidermal water loss value by using Tewameter between immediate and delayed (30 minutes) moisturizer application after bathing.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The skin hydration (capacitance value) and TEWL value were assessed at baseline and every 30 minutes for 120 minutes after each regimen.

other_outcome.measure: Skin hydration(capacitance value) by using Corneometer and transepidermal water loss value by using Tewameter between water and mild cleanser
other_outcome.time_frame: The skin hydration (capacitance value) and TEWL value were assessed at baseline and every 30 minutes for 120 minutes after each regimen.

arm_group.description: The patients in water group were soaking an arm for 10 minutes with tap water before application of moisturizer. (Excepted the 4th regimen included no bathing, waited for 10 minutes and followed by moisturizer application.)

The patients in mild cleanser group were soaking an arm for 10 minutes with mild cleanser before application of moisturizer. (Excepted the 4th regimen included no bathing, waited for 10 minutes and followed by moisturizer application.) Non soap base cleanser contained Sodium Cocoyl Isethionate was used in this mild cleanser arm.

intervention.description: regimen 1: soaking an arm for 10 minutes, no moisturizer application regimen 2: soaking an arm for 10 minutes,immediate moisturizer application regimen 3: soaking an arm for 10 minutes, delayed moisturizer application for 30 min. regimen 4: wait for 10 minutes,no soaking, moisturizer application (moisturizer alone) (All regimens were completed in all patients with 2 visits (7 days interval))
